body_html:
The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs.

@yinghai I noticed that you are exposing a Python-level API for backend graph optimization. I have some questions:

  1. Will you also provide a Python-level API for int8 calibration, the same way as TensorRT integration with Tensorflow?
  2. Will the APIs support multiple backends?
  3. Will the APIs support graph optimization for training?
body_text:
The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs.

@yinghai I noticed that you are exposing a Python-level API for backend graph optimization. I have some questions:

Will you also provide a Python-level API for int8 calibration, the same way as TensorRT integration with Tensorflow?
Will the APIs support multiple backends?
Will the APIs support graph optimization for training?
body:
> The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs.

@yinghai I noticed that you are exposing a Python-level API for backend graph optimization. I have some questions:
1. Will you also provide a Python-level API for int8 calibration, the same way as TensorRT integration with Tensorflow?
2. Will the APIs support multiple backends?
3. Will the APIs support graph optimization for training?
